dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/1261337580 at Thu May 13 22:48:55 UTC 2021

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: mailroom Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: mailroom Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

panels.title: emailsProcessed SLI Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="emailsProcessed",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="emailsProcessed",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="emailsProcessed",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="emailsProcessed",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="emailsProcessed",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: emailsProcessed SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Monitors incoming emails delivered from the imap inbox and processed through Sidekiq's `email_receiver` queue.
Note that since Mailroom has poor observability, we use Sidekiq metrics for this, and this could lead to certain Sidekiq problems
being attributed to Mailroom
panels.title: Details

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Records the total memory utilization for containers for this service, as a percentage of
the memory limit as configured through Kubernetes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization

panels.description:
The HPA is the [Horizontal Pod Autoscaler](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/horizontal-pod-autoscale/).
It automatically scales the number of Pods in a deployment based on metrics.

The HPA has a configured upper maximum. When this limit is reached, the HPA will not increase the number of pods and
other resource saturation (eg, CPU, memory) may occur.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, hpa, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kube_hpa_status_desired_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|memory-bound|urgent-other"}
      /
      kube_hpa_spec_max_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|memory-bound|urgent-other"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_hpa_desired_replicas component saturation: HPA Desired Replicas

panels.description:
A GKE kubernetes node pool is close to it's maximum number of nodes.

The maximum is defined in terraform, via the `max_node_count` field of a node pool. The limit is per-zone, so for
single zone clusters the number of nodes will match the limit, for regional clusters, the limit is multiplied by
the number of zones the cluster is deployed over.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, cluster, label_pool, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      count by (cluster, env, environment, label_pool, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        kube_node_labels:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"}
      )
      / on(cluster, env, environment, label_pool) group_left() (
        label_replace(
          terraform_report_google_cluster_node_pool_max_node_count,
          "label_pool", "$0", "pool_name", ".*"
        )
        * on(cluster, env, environment) group_left()
        count by (cluster, env, environment) (
          group by (cluster, env, environment, label_topology_kubernetes_io_zone) (
            kube_node_labels:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"}
          )
        )
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_pool_max_nodes component saturation: Kube Pool Max Node Limit

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom", component="open_fds"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that are breaching their soft SLO thresholds at this instant

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 1 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
  clamp_max(
    gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"}
    ,
    1
  ) >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or

panels.title: Currently Saturated Resources

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their current value and weekly variance, have a high probability of breaching their soft thresholds limits within the next few hours

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 7 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        environment="$environment",
        env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"
        }
      , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or

panels.title: Resources Currently at Risk of being Saturated

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their growth rate over the the past week, and their weekly variance, are likely to breach their soft thresholds limits in the next 14d

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 30 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:predict_linear_2w{
        environment="$environment",
        env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"
        }
    , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_inodes", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_inodes", severity="s2"})
or
